intro: Agathosma variabilis var. pubescens, commonly known as the Cape geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It is often used in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant due to its hardy nature and attractive appearance. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological and horticultural studies.
